article.source: The Laurel | "Fostering cooperation among legislative newspapermen (and women, and broadcast journalists, and bloggers, and media junkies)."
article.author: dubymcd
article.title: Sunday Talk
article.text:
Power & Politics News12 Saturday at 4:30 pm & 6:30/ Sunday 11:30am & 6:30pm.

Host: John Craven

–          New Vaccine Plan Faces Backlash:

o   Josh Geballe (Gov. Lamont’s Chief Operating Officer)

o   Sarah Peliter & DeShawn Brownel (essential workers)

o   Sal Luciano (CT AFL-CIO president / member of Gov. Lamont’s Vaccine Advisory Group)

o   Rochelle Palache (32BJ SEIU vice president)

o   Keri Hoehne (UFCW Local 371 executive vice president)

–          Early Voting Coming to CT?

o   Denise Merrill (CT Secretary of the State)

Plus: Gov. Lamont makes his pitch for recreational marijuana sales in CT

 

This Week in Connecticut WTNH 10:00 am

Host: Dennis House

Covid & marijuana 
Melissa McCaw, Budget director
Paul Mounds, Lamont Chief of staff
 
Minority vaccine rate 
Unclaimed money
State treasurer Shawn Wooden
 
Policing in pandemic 
Chief Vernon Riddick 
West Hartford police  
 

CT Capitol Report WTNH  10:30am

Host: Tom Dudchik

On set: Speaker of the House Matt Ritter, former state Senator John McKinney, Jodi Latina of News8

-Vaccine Plan Changes 

-Governor Lamont’s Marijuana Proposal

-New state GOP chair

-Bottle Bill

 
 

 

The Real Story  Fox61  10 a.m.

Host: Jenn Bernstein

Connecticut’s Chief Operating Officer Josh Geballe talks about Governor Ned Lamont’s new age-based vaccine plan.

Former Connecticut gubernatorial candidate Bob Stefanowski talks about his op-ed ‘What Isn’t the Matter With Hartford?’

Face the Facts WVIT 10 a.m.

Host: Mike Hydeck

Treasurer Shawn Wooden on paying down the state’s long-term debt, answering viewer questions about CHET and efforts to address economic disparities

Rep. Sean Scanlon (D-Guilford) on the bill that just passed the house to protect CT residents who work in other states from double taxation

Christine Stuart on the latest round of the Paycheck Protection Program

CT ’21  WFSB  8:30 a.m.

Host: Eric Parker

Covid Vaccines Distribution Plan – How an Age-Based System was Selected

– Josh Geballe / Chief Operating Officer for the State of Connecticut

Texas Electrical Crisis:  Could It Happen Here? 

– State Sen. Norm Needleman / (D) 33rd District &  Chair of the Senate Energy & Technology Committee
– Mark Paul, Ph.D. / Prof. of Economics & Environmental Studies at New College of Florida

Sunday Spotlight – The 2021 Travelers Championship/What Will It Look Like this Year?

– Chase Koepka/PGA Golfer

– Nathan Grube/Tournament Director for the Travelers Championship

The post Sunday Talk appeared first on The Laurel | "Fostering cooperation among legislative newspapermen (and women, and broadcast journalists, and bloggers, and media junkies).".
